page.title: 17Ladykirk church
page.content: Ladykirk parish runs along the north bank of the Tweed half-way between Coldstream and Berwick-upon Tweed. The Kirk of Our Lady of the Sheill or Ladykirk as it is now called- originated during a border raid. Legend tells us that King James(IV) of Scotland was nearly drowned whilst crossing the Tweed at the ford below the church and he vowed he would build a church in memory of the Blessed Virgin that could not be destroyed by fire or water, and would be built of stone entirely. In 1984 the stonework inside and out (which includes stone pews) was cleaned and guttering and drainage put in order. The 45 members share a minister with five neighbouring parishes. Consequently services are held only twice a month.
